alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 11 at 10:33AM ChST until October 11 at 2:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Guam... * Until 200 PM ChST. * At 1033 AM ChST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated continued rain falling across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible across Guam. Flooding continues to be a concern. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of rivers and stream, urban areas, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Guam. Southern Guam (south of Airport area) is the biggest concern due to river systems and hilly terrain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
